President of Serbia and Montenegro on Development of Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
President of Serbia and Montenegro on Development of Relations with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Serbia and Montenegro truly wishes to develop its relations with the DPRK in all fields including politics, economy and culture. 
 Svetozar Marovic, president of Serbia and Montenegro, on Nov. 30 said this when receiving credentials from DPRK Ambassador e. p. to Serbia and Montenegro Jo Sung Ju.    
 Saying that he is following major issues related to the Korean Peninsula, he wished steady progress in the work for the improvement of inter-Korean relations and Korea's reunification.

Actions for Defending Right to Existence Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions for Defending Right to Existence Called for in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of University Student Councils reportedly issued an appeal on Nov 24 calling for checking and frustrating the U.S. interference in the internal affairs of Korea and coming out in the struggle for defending the right to existence.
 Referring to the fact that the proposal on rice negotiations was railroaded through the "National Assembly" on Nov 23 despite the protest and objection from the people from all walks of life, the appeal deplored that the political camp railroaded the proposal through the NA though it was well aware that it would hit hard the farmers' existence. This was attributable to the U.S. interference in the internal affairs of south Korea, it added. 
 Accusing the U.S. of listing all vital fields of south Korea including agriculture and education as principal targets of its neo-liberal "globalization" in a bid to plunder its people and putting it under constant pressure, the appeal continued: It has sought to dump its rice in the south keeping officials of the government and media under its tight control. The U.S. ceaseless interference in the internal affairs of south Korea and its moves to pressurize it are not confined to the opening of the rice market.    
  Calling for giving vent to the farmers' indignation through a nationwide struggle against the U.S, the appeal underscored the need for the youths and students to take the lead in the struggle to put an end to the U.S. interference in the internal affairs of south Korea.

National Exhibition and Presentation of Scientific and Technological Achievements in Agriculture
articles.content:
National Exhibition and Presentation of Scientific and Technological Achievements in Agriculture 
    Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The Juche 94 (2005) national exhibition and presentation of scientific and technological achievements in agriculture were held here on Dec. 6 and 7.
 They brought together officials, scientists, technicians and teachers of agricultural scientific research and educational institutions and production sites. They were divided into panels of scientific farming, crop cultivation, crop seed production, land and agricultural chemistry, veterinary and stock-breeding and farm machines.    
 Highly appreciated there were achievements made in scientific researches which are paying off profusely in practice or help boost the agricultural production. They included new strains of rice, new technology for cultivating vegetable seedlings, technology for treating crop seeds with the help of laser, method of diagnosing bird flu by use of latest technology, direct rice sowing and movable air-tight crop thrashing combines of various types. 
 Certificates and prizes were awarded to the successful entrants at a closing ceremony held at the Academy of Agricultural Science on Wednesday.
 Present there were Minister of Agriculture Ri Kyong Sik, President of the Academy of Agricultural Science Kye Yong Sam, officials concerned, scientists, technicians and teachers.

DPRK Delegation Leaves for Russia
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Russia
    Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries led by its Vice-Chairman Jon Hyon Chan left Pyongyang today to visit Russia.
 It was seen off at the airport by an official concerned and the minister councilor of the Russian embassy here.

articles.title: Congratulations to Liberian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Liberian President
    Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Dec. 7 sent a congratulatory message to Ellen Johnson Sirleaf upon her election as president of Liberia.
 The message expressed the conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples and sincerely wished her big success in her responsible work for national unity, peace and stability of the country and its reconstruction.
